title: HeartSense AI web app for Smart CVD Risk Prediction

requirements.text: Create a public-facing landing page for “HeartSense AI: Smart CVD Risk Prediction” that explains the project (what it does, who it’s for, and how to use it) and includes a clear call-to-action to start a risk assessment.

quotes: HeartSense AI : Smart CVD Risk Prediction i am doing this project i want related web page to appy my project

acceptanceCriteria: Landing page renders with the title “HeartSense AI” and subtitle “Smart CVD Risk Prediction”.
Page includes sections: Overview, How it works, Disclaimer, and a prominent “Start Assessment” button that navigates to the assessment form.
All user-facing text is in English.

requirements.text: Implement a CVD risk assessment form page where a user can enter typical risk-factor inputs (at minimum: age, sex, systolic blood pressure, total cholesterol, HDL cholesterol, smoking status, diabetes status) and submit to get a prediction result.

quotes: i want related web page to appy my project

acceptanceCriteria: Form includes the minimum fields listed in the requirement with sensible input types (number/radio/select) and client-side validation (required fields, reasonable min/max).
On submit, the UI shows a loading state and then displays a result view without a full page reload.
If validation fails, the user sees clear inline error messages.

requirements.text: Add a backend prediction API in the single Motoko actor that accepts the assessment inputs and returns a deterministic risk result containing: numeric riskScore (0–100), riskLevel (Low/Moderate/High), and an explanation array describing the main contributing factors based on the submitted inputs.
acceptanceCriteria: Backend exposes a single callable method (e.g., predict) that takes the required inputs and returns { riskScore; riskLevel; explanation }.
Returned riskScore is always clamped to 0–100 and riskLevel is one of: Low, Moderate, High.
Explanation contains at least 2 human-readable strings describing how inputs influenced the result (e.g., “Higher systolic BP increases risk”).

requirements.text: Connect the assessment form submission to the backend prediction API using the project’s standard frontend data-fetching pattern (React Query) and render a results page/section showing riskScore, riskLevel, and the explanation list, plus a “Start Over” option.

quotes: i want related web page to appy my project

acceptanceCriteria: Submitting the form calls the backend prediction API and displays the returned values.
Result UI displays: riskLevel, riskScore, and explanation items in a readable layout.
User can reset the form and run another assessment via a “Start Over” action.

requirements.text: Add a medical/educational disclaimer component shown on both the landing page and the results view stating the output is for informational/educational purposes and not medical advice, diagnosis, or treatment.
acceptanceCriteria: Disclaimer text is visible on landing and results views.
Disclaimer is written in clear English and does not claim clinical accuracy or diagnosis.

requirements.text: Apply a coherent visual theme for HeartSense AI across the app (colors, typography, spacing, components) with an accessible, health-oriented style (avoid blue/purple as primary colors) and consistent layout for navigation, content sections, and the form/results.

quotes: HeartSense AI : Smart CVD Risk Prediction

acceptanceCriteria: A consistent color palette and typography are applied across landing, form, and results views.
Primary UI elements (buttons, inputs, headings, cards) follow a unified style.
Color contrast is sufficient for readable text and form labels.

requirements.text: Add basic site navigation (header with app name and links to Home and Assessment) and a footer with project info (e.g., “HeartSense AI”) and the disclaimer link/summary.
acceptanceCriteria: Header navigation works and clearly indicates how to reach the assessment form from any page.
Footer appears on all main views and includes project name and a disclaimer reference.

requirements.text: Add generated static image assets for HeartSense AI (logo and simple health-themed hero illustration) and render them in the UI from frontend/public/assets/generated (do not serve images from the backend).

quotes: HeartSense AI : Smart CVD Risk Prediction

acceptanceCriteria: Images listed in imageRequirements.required exist in frontend/public/assets/generated and are referenced by the landing page (and logo by header).
App builds and runs without requiring backend image hosting.

constraints: Use a single Motoko actor for all backend logic.

Do not edit files under frontend immutable paths (frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, frontend/src/components/ui); compose/reuse them instead.
Use English for all user-facing text.
nonGoals: Integrating or training a real ML model for CVD prediction (this build uses a deterministic scoring approach suitable as a placeholder/demo).
Clinical validation, regulatory/medical-device compliance, or guaranteeing medical accuracy.
Third-party authentication providers (only Internet Identity is supported, and it is not required for this initial web page unless later requested).

required: Minimal heart + pulse line logo, flat vector style, warm health palette (heartsense-logo.dim_512x512.png)
Hero illustration of a heart with subtle medical UI elements (charts/metrics) in a clean flat style (heartsense-hero.dim_1600x900.png)
Small set of 3 simple line icons: shield/health, chart, checklist, consistent stroke style (heartsense-icons.dim_512x512.png)
